snippet: The Afghan president, Hamid Karzai, said the United States was playing a “double game” by not taking the fight against insurgents to Pakistan and by not supplying his country with weapons.
abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai accuses the United States of playing a 'double game' by fighting a war against Afghan insurgents rather than their backers in Pakistan, and by refusing to supply his country with weapons it needs to fight enemies across the border; threatens to turn to China, India and Russia for those arms.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and HABIB ZAHORI

lead_paragraph: The Afghan president, Hamid Karzai, said the United States was playing a “double game” by not taking the fight against insurgents to Pakistan and by not supplying his country with weapons.

headline.seo: An Angry Karzai Accuses U.S. of Duplicity in Fighting Afghan Enemies
headline.main: Karzai Accuses U.S. of Duplicity in Fighting Afghan Enemies
headline.print_headline: Angry Karzai Accuses U.S. of Duplicity in Fighting Afghan Enemies
